alert.note: Alert for Boone; McHenry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 20 at 5:18PM CDT until April 20 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN MCHENRY AND NORTHERN BOONE COUNTIES... At 516 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Candlewick Lake, or over Poplar Grove, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At about 510 PM, trained spotters reported quarter sized hail in the Rockford area. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Belvidere, Harvard, Poplar Grove, Spring Grove, Candlewick Lake, Richmond, Sharon, Capron, Hebron, Timberlane, Chemung and Caledonia. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for north central and northeastern Illinois.
